subject: Politics
title: Why Democracy
description: A quick win: understand Why Democracy.

hook.text: Churchill called democracy the worst form of government except all the others. Why do we accept such a messy system?

buildup.text: Democracy's case rests on equality, accountability, and protecting rights. No other system gives citizens real voice.

discovery.text: Democracies rarely wage war on each other, produce more prosperity, and protect minorities better than alternatives.

twist.text: Democracy can be slow, polarized, and captured by money. Voters sometimes choose demagogues who destroy the system.

climax.text: Democracy's value isn't perfection. It's the ability to correct mistakes peacefully through elections and debate.

punchline.text: Democracy is messy by design. The mess is what makes it self-correcting.

quiz.question: What is often cited as democracy's greatest strength?
options: Its ability to correct mistakes peacefully through elections and debate
Its speed in making decisions compared to other systems
Its guarantee of perfect outcomes for all citizens
